fast3d.complex.light

Class ObstructableLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.complex.light.ObstructableLight
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Light
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectionalLight, PointLight

    public abstract class ObstructableLight
extends java.lang.Object
implements Light
    some forms of light (e.g. directional- or point- light) may cause shadows
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean calculateShadows
      determines whether to calculate all shadows caused by this light-source (may cause insane computational effort)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObstructableLight(Universe uni)
      for illuminating it has to be calculated, whether an illuminatable lays in the shadow of another

      abstract Vector3d getPos()
      to calculate all Renderables between the currently to illuminate Illuminatable and the light source using ray tracing it it necessary to create a ray out if the lights position to not consider renderables behind the light (from the currently to illuminate Illuminatable) as being in front of the light

      calculates the visible color for the given illuminatable;

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObstructableLight

        public ObstructableLight(Universe uni)
        for illuminating it has to be calculated, whether an illuminatable lays in the shadow of another
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • illuminate

        public abstract Color illuminate(Illuminatable c)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        calculates the visible color for the given illuminatable;
        the visible color is the color of the pixels on the screen for the given renderable
        Specified by:
        illuminate in interface Light
        Parameters:
        c - the illuminatable giving the data of its surface
        Returns:
        the visible color to draw the illuminatable in if no other light is used

      • obstructings

        public java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> obstructings(Illuminatable l)
        should be used by illuminate(Illuminatable) to determine whether the Illuminatable to currently illuminate lays in the shadow of another
        Parameters:
        l - the illuminatable to illuminate just yet
        Returns:
        a list of any Renderables that is in between of the Illuminatable and the light-source or null if no Renderable causes shadow to the parameter

      • directionOfLight

        public abstract Vector3d directionOfLight(Illuminatable l)
        any obstructable light has to have a direction of it's light-rays
        Parameters:
        l - may for different Illuminatable the light has to target in a different direction
        Returns:
        the direction of the rays of light

      • getPos

        public abstract Vector3d getPos()
        to calculate all Renderables between the currently to illuminate Illuminatable and the light source using ray tracing it it necessary to create a ray out if the lights position to not consider renderables behind the light (from the currently to illuminate Illuminatable) as being in front of the light
        Returns:
        the lights position

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        compares this with the parameter and returns false if the parameter is not of the same type
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        whether this and the given ObstructableLight are equal considering their universe and whether they do shadowing calculations

      • getUniverse

        public Universe getUniverse()
        Returns:
        the universe in which the shadowing calculation is done
